title: Installation issue: hdf+fortran %gcc@10.2.0 build fails
body:
Looks like building HDF with fortran support fails with GCC 10.2.0 due to some changes in gfortran.

**OS:** CentOS 8 on AMD Rome
**Spack version:** 0.16.1

My installation spec:
```
hdf@4.2.15%gcc@10.2.0+external-xdr+fortran~java~netcdf+pic~shared+szip arch=linux-centos8-zen2
```

Error message:
```
     494      132 |       mgsnatt = mgisattr(riid, name, nt, count, data, len(name))
     495          |                                                2
     496    ......
     497      155 |       mgsattr = mgisattr(riid, name, nt, count, data, len(name))
     498          |                                                1
  >> 499    Error: Type mismatch between actual argument at (1) and actual argument at (2) (CHARACTER(0)/INTEGER(4)).
     500    make[3]: *** [Makefile:679: mfgrff.lo] Error 1
     501    make[3]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
     502    dff.c: In function 'dfiopen_':
     503    dff.c:69:11: warning: cast from pointer to integer of different size [-Wpointer-to-int-cast]
```
Looks like the error message is identical to the one reported in netcdf-fortran git repo: https://github.com/Unidata/netcdf-fortran/issues/212

This can be fixed by passing the argument `-fallow-argument-mismatch` to gfortran as described in the issue. I'll initiate a PR shortly.
